tuv.seg: Toll roads are in existence throughout the world and have been in operation in Ireland since the 1980s
Tá bóithre dola ann ar fud an domhain agus tá siad in Éirinn ón na blianta 1980
In general toll roads impose a toll (levy or charge) on each vehicle using these roads
De ghnáth leagann na bóithre dola dola (tobhach nó táille) ar gach feithicil a bhíonn ag úsáid na mbóithre seo
Transport Infrastructure Ireland (TII) has responsibility for overseeing the implementation of tolling throughout Ireland
In Éirinn tá Bonneagar Iompar Éireann (TII) freagrach as maoirsiú a dhéanamh ar fheidhmiú an chórais dola
In addition, TII also has responsibility for planning, supervising constructing and maintaining all national roads
Ina theannta sin, tá TII freagrach freisin as na bóithre náisiúnta uile a phleanáil, as maoirsiú a dhéanamh ar a dtógáil agus as iad a chothabháil
Why are toll charges imposed?
Cad chuige a ngearrtar táillí dola?
Transport Infrastructure Ireland is empowered by the Local Government (Toll Roads) Act, 1979 to charge and collect tolls for the use of certain roads by vehicles
Tá an cumas ag Bonneagar Iompar Éireann de bhun an Achta Rialtais Áitiúil (Bóithre Dola), 1979, dolaí a ghearradh agus a bhailiú ar fheithiclí as úsáid a dhéanamh de bhóithre áirithe
Before a toll may be imposed on a road, a bye-law under the Act must be passed
Sula ngearrtar dola ar aon bhóthar, ní mór fodhlí a rith de réir an Achta
Major new road developments are now undertaken and funded through Public Private Partnership (PPP)
Is minic anois a mhaoinítear agus a théitear i mbun forbairtí móra bóthair thrí bhíthin na comhpháirtíochta príobháidí poiblí
This means that part of the funding for road building and maintenance comes from public sources (i.e., the Irish government) and part of the funding comes from private commercial sources
Is é sin le rá, go dtagann cuid den mhaoiniú le haghaidh bóithre a thógáil agus chothabháil ó fhoinsí poiblí (.i. Rialtas na hÉireann) agus cuid de ó fhoinsí príobháideacha tráchtála

Transport Infrastructure Ireland use of Public Private Partnership projects is in accordance with the strategy of using tolling to the maximum extent possible on these roads to recoup part at least of the substantial private sector investment involved

Tá an úsáid a bhaineann Bonneagar Iompar Éireann as tionscadail chomhpháirtíochta príobháidí poiblí i gcomhréir leis an straitéis atá ann dolaí a ghearradh an oiread agus is féidir ar na bóithre seo d’fhonn cuid ar a laghad den infheistíocht shuntasach a rinne an earnáil príobháidí a chúiteamh

Under the approach being pursued by Transport Infrastructure Ireland, toll roads are being constructed as additions to the current network of national roads rather than providing a means of improvement of existing roads
De réir mhodh oibre Bonneagar Iompar Éireann, tá bóithre dola á dtógáil mar bhreis ar an líonra bóithre náisiúnta atá ann anois, seachas mar chaoi leis na bóithre atá ann cheana a fheabhsú
New toll road schemes
Scéimeanna nua bóithre dola
Each time a toll scheme is proposed for a road, Transport Infrastructure Ireland must publish a public notice notifying citizens in the area that this change is being proposed
Gach uair a fhoilsítear scéimh dola do bhóthar, caithfidh Bonneagar Iompar Éireann fógra poiblí a fhoilsiú ag tabhairt le fios do mhuintir na háite go bhfuil an t-athrú seo á mholadh

In addition, Transport Infrastructure Ireland is required to produce a Draft Toll Scheme and citizens are invited to inspect the scheme for a period of one month and make observations/submissions on the scheme

Ina theannta sin, tá iallach ar Bonneagar Iompar Éireann Dréacht-Scéim Dola a chur ar fáil agus tugtar cuireadh ar feadh míosa don phobal an scéim a iniúchadh agus a gcuid tuairimí / aighneachtaí ar an scéim a chur i láthair
If you have an objection to the scheme, you must make your objections clearly in writing to Transport Infrastructure Ireland on or before the specified date
Má tá rud ar bith agat le cur in aghaidh na scéime, caithfidh tú do chuid agóidí a chur faoi bhráid Bonneagar Iompar Éireann go soiléir i scríbhinn ar an dáta nó roimh an dáta a luaitear

The Draft Toll Scheme for a particular road and its accompanying Explanatory Statement will be prepared in accordance with the statutory provisions of the Roads Act 1993, as amended by the Planning and Development Act 2000
Réiteofar an Dréacht-Scéim Dola d’aon bhóthar ar leith agus an Ráiteas Mínithe a théann léi de réir forálacha reachtúla Acht na mBóithre 1993, arna leasú ag an Acht um Pleanáil agus Forbairt 2000

Transport Infrastructure Ireland will serve a Notice on the local authorities in whose areas the proposed toll road will be located informing them that a Draft Toll Scheme has been prepared for the road concerned and indicating that representations in relation to the proposal may be made in writing to TII within a specified period

Déanfaidh Bonneagar Iompar Éireann fógra a sheirbheáil ar na húdaráis áitiúla arb ina limistéir a shuífear an bóthar dola atá beartaithe, ag cur in iúl dóibh go bhfuil Dréacht-Scéim Dola tar éis a réitithe don bhóthar áirithe agus a rá leo gur féidir uiríll scríofa a dhéanamh maidir leis an mbeart chun Bonneagar Iompar Éireann go ceann tréimhse a shaineofar

If objections to the Draft Toll Scheme are received and not withdrawn, Transport Infrastructure Ireland will arrange an oral hearing in the areas where the proposed toll road will be located to enquire into the matters to which the objections relate

Má fhaightear agóidí in aghaidh na Dréacht-Scéime Dola agus nach dtarraingítear siar iad, eagróidh Bonneagar Iompar Éireann éisteacht ó bhéal sna háiteanna a bhfuil sé beartaithe an bóthar dola a shuíomh d’fhonn iniúchadh a dhéanamh ar na cúrsaí lena mbaineann na hagóidí

The report and recommendations of the person appointed to hold the hearing will be considered by the Board of Transport Infrastructure Ireland prior to determining whether or not to adopt the Draft Toll Scheme
Breithneoidh Bord an Bonneagar Iompar Éireann tuarascáil agus moltaí an duine a ceapadh chun an éisteacht a thionól sula gcinnfear ar an Dréacht-Scéim a ghlacadh nó gan í a ghlacadh
Transport Infrastructure Ireland may adopt the Draft Toll Scheme with or without modifications or may refuse to adopt it
Féadfaidh Bonneagar Iompar Éireann an Dréacht-Scéim a ghlacadh le nó gan athruithe nó féadfaidh sé diúltú di
The decision of TII on the Toll Scheme proposal will be published
Foilseofar cinneadh Bonneagar Iompar Éireann maidir leis an Dréacht-Scéim Dola
Exemptions from toll charges
Díolúintí ó tháillí dola
Certain vehicles are exempt from toll charges
Tá feithiclí áirithe saor ó tháillí dola

The vehicles in question are vehicles belonging to and used for official purposes by the Defence Forces, vehicles used by An Garda Siochana (the Irish police force), fire brigade vehicles and ambulances

Is iad na feithiclí atá i gceist feithiclí le hÓglaigh na hÉireann nó a úsáideann Óglaigh na hÉireann, feithiclí a úsáideann An Garda Síochána (póilíní na hÉireann), feithiclí na briogáide dóiteáin agus otharcharranna
Vehicles adapted for disabled drivers or passengers are also entitled to exemption from toll fees
Tá na feithiclí a cuireadh in oiriúint do thiománaithe nó paisinéirí faoi mhíchumas seo saor freisin ó tháillí dola
Toll road operators issue special passes which are recognised by all other toll road operators and which allow such vehicles pass through the tolls without paying
Eisíonn na hoibreoirí bóthair pasanna speisialta a aithníonn na hoibreoirí bóthair eile go léir agus a ligeann d’fheithiclí dá leithéid dul tríd an dola gan íoc
To obtain a special pass apply to your nearest toll road operator
Le pas speisialta a fháil déan iarratas leis an oibreoir bóthair is gaire duit
Penalties for not paying toll fees
Pionóis faoi gan táillí dola a íoc
Tolls and penalties can be recovered either through a criminal or civil procedure
Is féidir cáin bhealaigh agus pionóis a fháil trí ghnáthamh coiriúil nó sibhialta
You can be charged with an offence of not paying your toll or not obeying the instruction of an authorised person
Is féidir leat a bheith cúisithe le coir mura íocann tú do cháin bhealaigh nó mura n-éisteann tú le treoir ó dhuine ainmnithe
The penalty on summary conviction is a fine not exceeding €5,000 or a term of imprisonment not exceeding 6 months, or both
Is é an pionós a bhaineann le ciontú achomair ná fíneáil nach bhfuil níos mó ná €5,000 nó tréimhse príosúnachta nach bhfuil níos faide ná 6 mhí, nó an dá rud
On the M50, the bye-laws set out penalties for those who fail, refuse or neglect to pay toll fees
Ar an M50, leagann na fodhlithe amach pionóis dóibh siúd nach íocann, a dhiúltaíonn nó a dhéanann dearmad táillí cháin bhealaigh a íoc
These are as follows:
Is iad seo a leanas:
• Initial default - penalty charge of €3.00
• Réamhshocraithe Tosaigh - muirear pionós € 3.00
• After 14 days - additional penalty charge of €41.00
• Tar éis 14 lá - muirear pionós breise de € 41.00
• After further 56 days - additional penalty charge of €102.50
• Tar éis tuilleadh 56 lá - muirear pionós breise de € 102.50
• Total fines per passage - €146.50
• Fíneálacha iomlán in aghaidh an sliocht - € 146.50
The amount of tolls and penalties due are recoverable as a contract debt
Tá méid na gcánacha bealaigh agus na bpionós le híoc in-aisghabhála mar fhiach conartha
The registered owner of a vehicle is responsible even if you are not driving the vehicle
Tá úinéir cláraithe na feithicle freagrach fiú mura bhfuil tú ag tiomáint na feithicle
This can be costly if there are multiple passages
D’fhéadfadh sé seo a bheith costasach má tá go leor bealaí
It is an offence to fail, neglect or refuse to pay a toll on a national road
Is cion é gan dola a íoc ar bhóthar náisiúnta nó faillí a dhéanamh san íoc nó diúltú é a íoc
Failure to pay your toll will mean that you cannot pass along the road
Mura n-íocann tú an dola ní fhéadfaidh tú dul feadh an bhóthair
The toll rates for the toll roads are available on Transport Infrastructure Ireland's website
Tá na rátaí dola do na bóithre dola le fáil ar láithreán gréasáin an Bonneagar Iompar Éireann:
The Dublin Port Tunnel imposes a toll on cars, taxis, motorcycles, vans and light commercial vehicles only
Leagann Tollán Chalafort Bhaile Átha Cliath dola ar charranna, thacsaithe, rothair ghluaiste, veaineanna agus ar fheithiclí tráchtála éadroma amháin
Commercial vehicles above 3.5 tonnes laden weight and buses wih more than 25 seats do not pay tolls
Ní íocann feithiclí tráchtála is mó ná 3.5 tonna agus iad luchtaithe aon dola ná busanna a bhfuil níos mó ná 25 shuíochán iontu
VAT registered road users can reclaim VAT paid on tolls
Is féidir le húsáideoirí bóithre atá cláraithe don CBL an CBL ar na dolaí a éileamh ar ais
Payment of tolls is facilitated in two ways - by payment of cash or by eToll
Tá dhá bhealach a chuireann ar do chumas dolaí a íoc - le hairgead tirim nó leis an eToll (rDhola)
Electronic tolling allows motorists to use electronic tolling lanes, thereby saving time and the need to carry cash when travelling through a toll road

Cuireann an doláil leictreonach ar chumas na ngluaisteánaithe lánaí dolála leictreonacha a úsáid, agus ar an gcaoi sin am a shábháil agus gan iallach a bheith orthu airgead a bheith acu agus iad ag taisteal feadh bóthair dhola
Electronic tolling uses a small electronic tag that is placed in the vehicle and is detected each time your vehicle passes through the toll
Úsáideann an doláil leictreonach clib leictreonach a chuirtear ar an bhfeithicil agus a bhraitear gach uair a théann an fheithicil tríd an dola
The toll is then debited against the customer's account
Cuirtear an dola do dochar chuntas an chustaiméara ansin
The electronic tolling system automatically recognises the correct toll for the class of vehicle you are driving
Aithníonn an córas dolála leictreonach go huathoibríoch an dola ceart don aicme feithicle atáthar a thiomáint
There are a number of companies providing electronic tags to motorists
Tá roinnt cuideachtaí in Éirinn a chuireann clibeanna leictreonacha ar fáil do ghluaisteánaithe

All these providers use the same system which means you only need one tag for all tolling facilities. Information on suppliers of electronic tags and the different types of tag accounts is available at tagcompare.ie
Úsáideann na soláthraithe seo go léir an córas céanna, agus mar sin ní theastóidh ach an chlib chéanna uait le haghaidh saoráidí dolála uile na hÉireann
Since August 2008 the West Link Bridge on the M50 operates a barrier-free tolling scheme called eFlow
Ó Lúnasa 2008 i leith tá scéim dolála gan bhacainn á hoibriú ar Dhroichead an Naisc Thiar ar an M50, ar a dtugtar eFlow
This allows all motorists to pass through the toll at motorway speed
Cuireann sé seo ar chumas na ngluaisteánaithe dul tríd an dola ar luas mótarbhealaigh
There are three methods of paying the tolls including using an electronic tag from eflow or a supplier mentioned
Tá trí bhealach ann leis an dola a íoc, agus gearrfar na táillí de réir an bhealaigh a úsáideadh
Charges varying depending on the method used. You cannot pay the toll with cash at the West Link Bridge, but the toll must be paid by 8 pm the next day
Ní fhéadfaidh tú an dola a íoc le hairgead tirim ag Droichead an Naisc Thiar, ach ní mór an dola a íoc faoina 8 i.n. an lá dar gcionn
You can find out more about the toll scheme at eflow.ie
Gheofar faisnéis eile faoin scéim dola ag eflow.ie
Generally, toll charges are paid at the barrier to the toll road
De ghnáth, íoctar na táillí dola ag an mbacainn ar an mbóthar dola
You can pay either in cash, or by using an eToll tag
Féadfaidh tú íoc le hairgead tirim nó ag baint leasa duit as clib eToll
For the West Link Bridge, if you do not have an account you must pay online, by phoning Locall 1890 501 050 or through Payzone outlets
Maidir le Droichead an Naisc Thiar, mura bhfuil cuntas agat, caithfidh tú íoc ar-líne, nó ag déanamh glao áitiúil duit ar 1890 501 050, nó trí asraonta Payzone
If you are interested in obtaining an eToll tag, simply contact one of the companies providing electronic tolling tags
Más suim leat clib eToll a fháil, níl le déanamh ach dul i dteagmháil le ceann de na cuideachtaí a chuireann clibeanna dolála leictreonaí ar fáil
If you have a complaint about a toll road operator or your electronic tag provider, you should contact the company to find out how to make a complaint
Má tá gearán agat faoi oibreoir dola-bhóthar nó do sholáthraí clib leictreonach, ba chóir duit dul i dteagmháil leis an gcuideachta a fháil amach conas gearán a dhéanamh
